subject: Ethics
title: Hiroshima Decision Debate
description: A quick, practical guide to Hiroshima Decision Debate.

hook.text: On August 6, 1945, one bomb killed 80,000 people instantly. Truman said it saved a million lives.

buildup.text: The argument: invading Japan would cost a million American casualties. The bomb would end it faster.

discovery.text: Truman chose to drop the bomb on a city full of civilians to shock Japan into unconditional surrender.

twist.text: Historians found Japan was already seeking peace through the Soviets. The bomb may not have been needed.

climax.text: The real question isn't whether it workedâ€”it's whether killing 200,000 civilians can ever be justified.

punchline.text: It ended the war. It haunts us still. Both are true.

quiz.question: What complicates the justification for dropping the atomic bomb on Hiroshima?
options: Historical evidence suggests Japan was already seeking peace before the bombing
Truman didn't know the bomb would work before authorizing the drop
The bomb was originally intended for a military base, not a city
